abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment (EA)
            identifies potential adverse impacts on the environment, as
            a result of construction, and rehabilitation activities,
            which include soil erosion, land, and water pollution due to
            improper waste disposal, and, loss of vegetative cover.
            Moreover, social impacts are likely to occur, namely health
            issues due to exposure to dust, noise, and traffic
            accidents. However, the EA specifies that land acquisition
            or loss of income are not expected as a result of schools
            construction. The EA recommends the use of standard
            environmental guidelines, including community participation
            in the process for re-vegetation propagation. Mitigation
            measures address the need to establish one primary
            decantation basin for each ten sand washers, as well as
            restoration of borrow pits, and provision of latrines. The
            use of cement and metal frames is strongly recommended to
            prevent vector diseases, in line with sanitation
            technologies. Appropriate site selection should identify the
            location of water effluents, to include as well water
            quality testing. During construction, soil surfaces should
            be protected, ensuring adequate drainage from gutters, and
            from wastewater collection points, while wastes, and solid
            waste management control should be ensured through disposal
            services. Public, and educational campaigns will contribute
            to improved health, through the provision of health and
            hygiene measures. Monitoring criteria should ensure that
            appropriate mitigation is being conducted.
